events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on a rainy day causing significant front-end vehicle damage.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after verifying that the incident involved a vehicle collision.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle the investigation and follow up on next steps.
The customer received official acknowledgment confirming the claim has been received and is under review.
The insurer requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and a copy of the driver’s license.
All requested documents including the police report and vehicle pictures were submitted by the customer.
The investigation into the accident details and liability has commenced with assigned adjusters.
Investigation completed confirming the accident circumstances and extent of vehicle damage.
A settlement amount was proposed based on the repair estimates and policy coverage terms.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the settlement offer and responsive communication.
The claim was officially approved following the customer's acceptance of the settlement proposal.
Payment for the vehicle repair was issued promptly to the customer’s designated bank account.
The claim was formally closed after confirming all payments and paperwork were completed.
